newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine group wins state post office bidding.
newsitem.headline: Argentine group wins state post office bidding.

text.p: Argentina's Post Office said Monday local firms Itron and Sideco, controlled by Grupo Macri, and Banco de Galicia, had won the bid for a 30-year concession to run the state post office.
The Argentine consortium, which has the technical backing of Britain's Post Office, won after offering a $51 million six-monthly fee.

The lowest offer from the three groups which qualified to bid was $30.77 million from local banking group Werthein and COINTEL, a holding company controlling Telefonica de Argentina, and New Zealand's Infratil International, with the technical support of the New Zealand Post.
COINTEL is owned by Telefonica de Espana, operator of Telefonica de Argentina, and Argentina's CEI Citicorp Holding SA.
Argentine companies TAC and ROMAN, together with local tycoon Samuel Liberman, owner of local cable TV firm VCC, and Germany's state post office, had offered $48.5 million.
